history.proof: srun best use: Nat.mul_1_r unfold: divides.

exceptions.exn: In environment p : nat Unable to unify "1 * 1" with "p".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat

Goal:
1 div p

Premises:
divides_0 : forall p : nat, p div 0
divides_0_inv : forall p : nat, 0 div p -> p = 0
mult_is_one : forall p q : nat, p * q = 1 -> p = 1 /\ q = 1
divides_trans : forall x y z : nat, x div y -> y div z -> x div z
own_multiple : forall x p : nat, x = p * x -> x = 0 \/ p = 1
divides_anti : forall x y : nat, x div y -> y div x -> x = y
divides_refl : forall x : nat, x div x
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Nat.add_lt_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m < -> n + p < m + p
Nat.add_le_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
Nat.mul_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n * (m * p) = n * m * p
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => 0 | BinNums.Npos p => BinPos.Pos.to_nat p end : BinNums.N -> nat Arguments BinNatDef.N.to_nat _%N_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.mul p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => m | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => n | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.add p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.odd_add_mul_even : forall n m p : nat, Nat.Even m -> Nat.odd (n + m * p) = Nat.odd n
Fin.rectS : forall P : forall n : nat, Fin.t (S n) -> Type, (forall n : nat, P n Fin.F1) -> (forall (n : nat) (p : Fin.t (S n)), P n p -> P (S n) (Fin.FS p)) -> forall (n : nat) (p : Fin.t (S n)), P n p
Nat.mod_1_l : forall a : nat, 1 < a -> 1 mod a = 1
Nat.lt_0_1 = (fun lemma : 1 = 1 => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.lt_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive 0) 1 1 lemma) Nat.one_succ (Nat.lt_succ_diag_r 0) : 0 < 1
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => match m with | BinNums.N0 => true | BinNums.Npos _ => false end | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => false | BinNums.Npos q => BinPos.Pos.eqb p q end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.eqb (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.one_succ = eq_refl : 1 = 1
Nat.ones_wd = fun (x y : nat) (H : x = y) => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive (Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 x)) (Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 y)) (Nat.pred_wd (Nat.shiftl 1 x) (Nat.shiftl 1 y) (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.shiftl_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive 1) x y H)) (Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 y)) (Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 y)) (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 y))) (RelationClasses.reflexivity (Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 y))) : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) Nat.ones
Nat.le_0_1 = Nat.lt_le_incl 0 1 Nat.lt_0_1 : 0 <= 1
